summary: This is an internal email chain from February 25, 2021, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, forwarding a report about a call from a woman claiming to be a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The email requests FBI screening of the potential witness and provides context about previous unproductive communications with her attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the perpetrator whose victim the caller claims to be.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the embedded email subject line regarding coverage of her arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell's arrest is mentioned in the context of an Epstein accuser, implying their association in the criminal case.

events.title: Potential victim call to SDNY
events.description: A woman calls the U.S. Attorney's Office, identifies herself as a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein, and provides contact information, prompting a request for FBI screening.

events.title: Previous communications with victim attorney
events.description: The SDNY was in contact with an attorney who claimed to represent at least nine Epstein victims unwilling to speak, with communications eventually breaking down.

keyFacts: On February 25, 2021, a woman called the SDNY claiming to be a former victim of Jeffrey Epstein and provided her contact information.
The caller stated her attorney had not been in touch with prosecutors, though she had previously contacted an NYPD detective.
The SDNY had prior unproductive communications in 2020 with an attorney who claimed to represent multiple Epstein victims unwilling to cooperate.
The email requests the FBI conduct an initial screening of the potential witness to assess if she has useful information for the investigation.
